thread.title: CBS Anchor Abruptly Fired, Escorted Out of Building by Security
thread.title_full: CBS Anchor Abruptly Fired, Escorted Out of Building by Security

author: Madeleine Weast
title: CBS Anchor Abruptly Fired, Escorted Out of Building by Security
text:
Former "Good Morning America" anchor Josh Elliot was abruptly fired and escorted out of the building by security from CBS on Monday. Elliot shocked his own bosses after he made an emotional farewell announcement on Friday unbeknownst to CBS executives.
"It has been by any measure a great stay here at CBSN," Elliot said on Friday, noting it would be his last day.
Elliot, who joined the CBS from NBC in 2016, met with the network's head of talent Laurie Orlando. Orlando, "wanted him to take on a bigger role at CBS News," Page Six reported on Monday..
"Josh was called to a meeting with CBS News heads including [president] David Rhodes and fired," a source told Page Six. 
The source also told the publication that Elliot had to be escorted out of the building by security after the debacle.
"CBS News and Josh Elliott are parting ways. Josh will no longer be reporting for CBS News. We are grateful for his contributions over the last year, and we wish him the very best in his future endeavors," CBS said in a statement.
In addition, the Page Six source claimed no one has been able to make contact with Orlando since the incident.
